chat.msg: hi there, empezamos?
hi, si vamos a empezar
perfecto! estoy en el punto de inicio
veo una ramita que lleva a una isla pequeña con un tigre. ¿hacia dónde debo ir?
Si, cross la ramita donde esta el loro
ok, crucé la ramita
estoy en la pequeña isla con el tigre. ¿ahora qué?
Puedes ver el loro?
veo una isla grande al suroeste con un loro en un árbol
¿es hacia allí?
si
genial, ahora estoy con el loro
cerca veo un elefante. ¿debo seguir al elefante?
No, vas a cross donde esta unas piedras
entendido, voy a cruzar las piedras
ahora estoy en una nueva isla con una rana
Si, cruzas hacia arriba de un alligator
genial, cruzado sobre el cocodrilo, y aquí está el elefante nuevamente
¿ahora qué?
Muy bien, cruzas otras piedras y vas a ver a una jirafa
got it, veo la jirafa ahora, ¿hacia dónde debería ir después?
Cruzas la ramita y vas a ver una vibora color rosa y amarilla
hecho, la vibora rosa y amarilla está a la vista
¿y ahora qué?
Mucho cuidado y vas a ver el treasure chest
yup, después de dos pasos hacia el este veo el tesoro
*finished* ¿lo hicimos bien?

chat.msg: hey there, estas listo?
hola, si listo
awesome, vamos! first, head a few steps to the west from our white dog friend, just under that wooden bench

now, cross that trail going toward the florist stand but, oh no, we're not going there! cheeky, ain't it? make a u-turn 180 degrees to your left, cross the trail again and make your way back towards our furry friend. how did that feel?
Yes, you are very funny!  I enjoy solving puzzles
brilliant! let's keep this fun rolling then. now, right from our fluffy buddy, i need you to head straight down, southwards
oh, look, another white dog, how cute! it's guarding a red and white checkered picnic mat. are you with me so far?
Yes
nice! pass right over this mat, touched that bowl of berries, didn't you? just keep heading west from here
Ok, now where do I go, please?
sure thing! step onto that wooden branch and use it to cross the river going north
tell me once you're across!
Ive crossed the wooden branch
good job! now, steer clear of that green bush ahead; don't touch it
instead, go right round it, heading towards the florist stand. just yell when you're there
Im here
great! now turn west, go under the stand and head straight towards the bridge
watch for those two people on the bike - we don't want any accidents
Ok, Im at the bridge
superb! just walk past the bridge some more to your west
see those two oldies catching up on their news on a bench? keep them in your sight
Got it
nice! now sneak past the bench, head a bit south, right between them and our old trusty wooden branch
Great I am at the wooden branch.
excellent! hang tight, we're almost there
see the green bush near the end of the branch? just inch your way eastward between the branch and the bush. tell me how it goes!

chat.msg: hey, estas listo?
Hi, si
genial! estoy en una carpa al norte del mapa
¿por dónde voy?
Camina hacia el sur y vas a ver un perro
de acuerdo, veo al perro junto al fuego
¿giro a la derecha o a la izquierda?
A la derecha, y camina alrededor del fuego y vas a ver unos hongos
ya veo los hongos rojos, ¿dónde debería ir a partir de aquí?
Vas a caminar sureste y despues vas a girar a la izquierda
¡perfecto! ahora veo un coche azul
¿sigo adelante?
Si, vas por el trail en la direction sur y vas a ver un telescope
lo encontré, el telescopio azul en el sur! ¿y ahora qué?
Camina mas para el sur, y despues giras a la izquierda y vas a ver un log cabin
¡lo conseguí! estoy en la casa rodeada de rocas
*terminado*! gracias, amigo!

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to play?
Hi, yes ready, listo
awesome! so, you're by the three palm trees, right? let's stroll towards the southwest passing under the first tree. take a quick right and scoot by the second palm tree
then bang a sharp left going south before the third tree. sweet navigating!
Ok great
perfect! now, you're going to see a cutie brown puppy up ahead
stay to its left, curve a little bit towards the left, then swing a hard right going south. how are we doing?
I see some large rocks
terrific! look for the big rock on your left and a little rock on your right
just squeeze yourself through the middle. the ocean's your next stop!
Great!  I am at the ocean
killer! now you're gonna face a groovy red crab
stay cool, turn right, hugging the big rock and make your way west in the water
Ok, I am in the water
rad! keep going west till you hit a medium-sized rock
Am I going to pass a shark?
you bet! the moment you come face-to-face with a shark, just yank to your right, you'll do great
I am at the medium rock
dope! let's get back on dry land now
squeeze between the medium rock and that trippy blue-yellow-white ball, and march north. alright?
Ok got it, back on land
cool beans! now gently swerve left and head northwest
you'll cross between a red tent and a big speaker
Ok, crossed
fantastic! now take a leisurely arc around the red tent and then head south
careful, don't dip your toes in the sea!
Ok, I am still on land
awesome! now mosey west, just below that snazzy red kayak
how's it going?
Great, I just passed under the kayak
fantastic! take a sharp right (north), cruise along the kayak, and green is your next color!

general_survey.answer: Yes, I live in an area which is predominantly Hispanic, and Spanish is spoken just as much as English is.
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: I think it is when they can't figure out a word and so they say the word in their native language instead.
general_survey.question: What do you think when others mix languages in conversation? Please explain:

general_survey.answer: I grew up learning and applying both English and Spanish.
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your language background?
